sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The maxcolor function is used to determine the maximum color number for the current mode of the screen. The alternate spelling is maxcolour.
sections.mdown_content: The **maxcolor** function is used to** **determine the maximum color number for the current mode of the screen. The alternate spelling is **maxcolour**.

sections.title: Example
code:
setscreen ("graphics")
        Â…
        put "The maximum color number is ", View.maxcolor
sections.raw_content: This program outputs the maximum color number.
sections.mdown_content: This program outputs the maximum color number.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The screen should be in a "screen" or "graphics" mode. If it is not, it will automatically be set to "screen" mode. See View.Set for details.

For IBM PC compatibles in "screen" mode, maxcolor = 15. For the default IBM PC compatible "graphics" mode (VGA), maxcolor = 15.
sections.mdown_content:
The screen should be in a "*screen*"* *or "*graphics*" mode. If it is not, it will automatically be set to "*screen*" mode. See **View.Set **for details.
For IBM PC compatibles in "*screen*"* *mode, **maxcolor** = 15. For the default IBM PC compatible "*graphics*" mode (VGA), **maxcolor** = 15.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: View.maxcolor is identical to RGB.maxcolor. It is placed here for consistency with other screen information routines.
sections.mdown_content: **View.maxcolor** is identical to **RGB.maxcolor**.  It is placed here for consistency with other screen information routines.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling View.maxcolor. Note that RGB.maxcolor is exported unqualified, so that one can call maxcolor.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling **View.maxcolor**. Note that **RGB.maxcolor** is exported unqualified, so that one can call **maxcolor**.
